sorting package¶

Submodules¶

sorting.natural_sort module¶

sorting.natural_sort.atoi(text: str) → typing.Union[int, str]¶

returns numeric representation of text if possible else original text

Parameters:text (str) – text whose numeric representation is needed
Returns:the integer representation of the number if possible else the original text
Return type:typing.Union[int, str]
sorting.natural_sort.get_natural_keys(text: str) → typing.List[typing.Union[int, str]]¶

list.sort(key=natural_keys) sorts in human order http://nedbatchelder.com/blog/200712/human_sorting.html

Parameters:text (str) – text that needs to be transformed into its natural format
Returns:list of integers and strings based on placement of digits and characters
Return type:typing.List[typing.Union[int, str]]
sorting.natural_sort.get_natural_sorted_list(input_list: typing.List[typing.Any]) → typing.List[typing.Any]¶

sort list of strings in natural order [“0”,”1”,”2”,”10”] instead of [“0”,”1”,”10”,”2”]

Parameters:input_list (list of elements that need to be sorted) –
Returns:sorted list of elements in natural order
Return type:typing.List[typing.Any]
